newsitem.title: UK: Oxford Molecular in jv with Polymasc.
newsitem.headline: Oxford Molecular in jv with Polymasc.

text.p: Oxford Molecular Group Plc said on Tuesday that it had formed a strategic collaboration with Polymasc Pharmaceuticals to accelerate the discovery and development of a blood growth factor.
According to the agreement, Oxford Molecular would provide Polumasc with proprietary molecular design services aimed at identifying key agents which stimulate red blood cell production.
Polymasc would cover research costs and would provide Oxford Molecular with milestone and royalty payments. Financial details were not disclosed.
Blood growth factors are used in the treatment of cancer, anaemia and AIDS. The global market for compounds in the therapeutic area was estimated at $4.0 billion.
